entry.title: blog3
entry.summary: Finally, I wanted a lightbox. The pelican photos documentation again very helpfully provides some code to achieve this and explains what to do with it. I just had to change a few lines to get it working with my theme. Instead of linking to an external jQuery, I just sourced …
entry.content: Finally, I wanted a lightbox. The pelican photos documentation again very helpfully provides some code to achieve this and explains what to do with it. I just had to change a few lines to get it working with my theme. Instead of linking to an external jQuery, I just sourced the local one necessary for my theme to work. I changed to . One more problem, however. The guide I was following said to put the magnific-popup.{js,css} files in the base of the theme directory, but the theme that I'm using checks for them in the css and js directories within a static. It will not work if you symlink the files instead of copying them. I ended up with the following code

entry.content: Finally, I wanted a lightbox. The pelican photos documentation again very helpfully provides some code to achieve this and explains what to do with it. I just had to change a few lines to get it working with my theme. Instead of linking to an external jQuery, I just sourced the local one necessary for my theme to work. I changed to . One more problem, however. The guide I was following said to put the magnific-popup.{js,css} files in the base of the theme directory, but the theme that I'm using checks for them in the css and js directories within a static. It will not work if you symlink the files instead of copying them. I ended up with the following code
